Package toDoLy

Class TaskManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • toDoLy.TaskManager
  • public class TaskManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The class TaskManager contains most of the methods that are connected to the editing option of the main menu, such as sort and display tasks according to due date or project, change project name, title, due date, as well as the status. Additionally the delete task method.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TaskManager()
      The method is sorting the task according to date or project with numerical options using the Comparator class.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void countStatus​(java.util.ArrayList<Task> list)
      The method countStatus counts the done and undone statuses of the objects of the ArrayList
      void displayTasks()
      The method displayTasks displays the tasks from the option
      void editOption​(java.util.ArrayList<Task> list)
      The method editOption includes all of the editing options for the task by giving the task title.
      java.util.ArrayList<Task> getList()
      The method getList fetches the created ArrayList
      void removeTask​(java.lang.String remTask, java.util.ArrayList<Task> list)
      The method removeTask stores the chosen to remove task in a string and uses the Iterator interface to iterate through the ArrayList and uses .equals to find the title that was given to be removed and removes it.
      static void sortDisplay​(java.util.ArrayList<Task> list, java.lang.String sortBy)

      • editOption

        public void editOption​(java.util.ArrayList<Task> list)
                throws java.io.IOException
        The method editOption includes all of the editing options for the task by giving the task title. All of the fields can be edited, project, title, due date, status as well as removes the task completely. Switch statements are also used for this purpose
        Parameters:
        list -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeTask

        public void removeTask​(java.lang.String remTask,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Task> list)
        The method removeTask stores the chosen to remove task in a string and uses the Iterator interface to iterate through the ArrayList and uses .equals to find the title that was given to be removed and removes it.
        Parameters:
        remTask - stores the chosen according to title task to be removed
        list - array list that stores the
